item.title: Coronavirus: A-level results to arrive after year with no exams
item.description: Grades will be higher but there are questions about the fairness of estimated A-level results.

item.title: Investigation into fatal Stonehaven train derailment begins
item.description: The train driver, a conductor and a passenger were killed in the crash in Aberdeenshire on Wednesday.

item.title: Joe Biden and Kamala Harris say Trump has left US 'in tatters'
item.description: Joe Biden and running mate Kamala Harris call President Donald Trump a "whining" incompetent leader.

item.title: UK heatwave: Severe storms forecast after scorching temperatures
item.description: Flooding, damage to buildings, travel disruption and power cuts are expected in several regions.

item.title: Dolphin stampede wows whale watchers
item.description: A safari group sailing near Dana Point in southern California came across a travelling pod of dolphins.

item.title: Coronavirus: No-exam A-level results due and New Zealand reports new cases
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus outbreak this Thursday morning.

item.title: Amazon Prime donates to Fleabag stars' theatre emergency fund
item.description: Amazon Prime is giving £1.5m to two UK funds offering support to workers affected by the virus.

item.title: Breast screening women in their 40s 'could save lives'
item.description: But experts caution there are many other considerations, including cost and over-diagnosis.

item.title: New Zealand coronavirus: 14 new Covid-19 cases reported
item.description: The country's biggest city, Auckland, is back in lockdown after a family cluster emerged.

item.title: Belarus election: Second protester dies as UN sounds alarm
item.description: Protesters accuse police of brutality in the wake of Sunday's disputed presidential election.

item.title: UK 'must anticipate hostile states utilising pandemic'
item.description: China and Russia are among countries willing to use coronavirus to their advantage, MPs say.

item.title: Coronavirus: Netflix to stream Diana musical before Broadway debut
item.description: The life story of the princess will become the first Broadway show to premiere on the small screen.

item.title: Golden eagles breeding success at Scottish Highlands estate
item.description: The raptors have bred on an estate in the Scottish Highlands for the first time in 40 years.

item.title: The Papers: Train crash aftermath and likely outcry over exams
item.description: Many of Thursday's front pages carry devastating pictures of the train derailment in Aberdeenshire.

item.title: Pardner: The young people saving money the Jamaican way
item.description: With finances stretched by Covid-19 these young people are supporting each other to save money.

item.title: Livestreaming in Asia: Meet the stars of 'shoppertainment'
item.description: As Covid-19 keeps millions of people at home, the popularity of "shoppertainment" has skyrocketed in Asia.

item.title: Rapper who refused Bollywood to become voice of poor
item.description: Dule, a former migrant worker, has turned to rap music to make a difference – and a living.

item.title: Sign cleaning gives Chatteris 'teenager with autism focus'
item.description: Joseph Beer, 15, is tidying up his neighbourhood and winning praise from residents.

item.title: Coronavirus: How ghost cruise ships became a summer tourist attraction
item.description: On the south coast, people have started going on sightseeing cruises of, well, cruise ships.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is a recession?
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has thrown many countries into recession - but what exactly is it and how could it affect you?

item.title: 'Why I stopped hiding my scars'
item.description: Jayne, Emily, Laura and Aimee talk about their scars, and how they came to accept them.

item.title: The millions being made from cardboard theft
item.description: With the global market for recycled cardboard worth billions of dollars, it is attracting criminals.

item.title: What Europe's cities are doing to handle heatwaves
item.description: As London swelters, we look at how urban areas can adapt to deal with higher temperatures.

item.title: Coronavirus: How can I find a new job?
item.description: Jobseekers are having a tough time at the moment but some sectors are hiring and support is available.

item.title: Why the Mauritius oil spill is so serious
item.description: The location of the Mauritian oil spill means the environmental consequences could be long-lasting.

item.title: Coronavirus: How will the world vaccinate seven billion?
item.description: Why fridges, vials and polling stations could be key in the distribution of a coronavirus vaccine.

item.title: Americans, go home: Tension at Canada-US border
item.description: Fears about spikes in US Covid-19 cases have led to some hostility between Canadians and Americans.

item.title: First-time buyers: Four ways the property market 'will be tougher'
item.description: UK house prices are predicted to fall but a report spells out why property may remain out of reach.

item.title: PSG in Champions League semi-finals after late goals shatter Atalanta
item.description: Paris St-Germain reach the semi-finals of the Champions League for the first time in 25 years after a sensational comeback against Atalanta.

item.title: Fluent O'Sullivan leads battling Selby in Crucible semi-final
item.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan earns a 5-3 lead against a battling Mark Selby in the World Championship semi-final.

item.title: Rangers ease St Johnstone aside to go top of Scottish Premiership
item.description: Manager Steven Gerrard says Rangers "let the game fizzle out" as they go top of the Scottish Premiership on goal difference with a win over St Johnstone.

item.title: 'Very silly to write Jimmy off' - Root backs Anderson before second Test
item.description: England bowler James Anderson is backed by captain Joe Root to return to "the peak of his powers" before second Test against Pakistan.

item.title: The man from Stoke and Mbappe's cameo - the joy of a one-off Champions League tie
item.description: Why the first taste of the streamlined Champions League final eight was a promising sign of things to come.

item.title: How can women's football regain momentum after lockdown?
item.description: After a summer with no elite women's football in England, is private investment needed to ensure the sport regains its momentum?

item.title: Will 'triple lock' affect me? And other questions
item.description: Are you concerned about your results? Experts answer some of your questions.

item.title: How will I get my A-level, GCSE or BTEC exam results this year?
item.description: Exams in the UK were cancelled this year, but how are students learning their results?

item.title: BTec Nationals: Who are the students who didn't just do A-levels?
item.description: All about the BTec National, one of the popular alternatives to A-levels.

item.title: Coronavirus: Should I go to university this year?
item.description: Will students have online or face-to-face learning this autumn, and will they still have to pay full fees?

item.title: Exam results: 'Mocks aren't a fair way to decide grades'
item.description: A-level student Mia Cleal-Bramley explains why she doesn't want to rely on her mock exam results.
